alert.note: Alert for Curry County Coast; South Central Oregon Coast (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: High Surf Advisory issued March 12 at 2:52PM PST until March 13 at 4:00PM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 1 AM PST TO 5 PM PDT SUNDAY... * WHAT...Large breaking waves of 22 to 27 feet. * WHERE...South Central Oregon Coast and Curry County Coast. * WHEN...From 1 AM PST to 5 PM PDT Sunday. * IMPACTS...Large breaking waves will create hazardous conditions along and within the surf zone, and could inundate beaches and low lying shorelines. Beach erosion is possible, and exposed infrastructure may be damaged. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Heavy surf will develop on the north coast tonight, spreading to the south coast early Sunday morning. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: Stay away from the surf zone and off of jetties. Area beaches may become hazardous due to dangerous surf conditions.

area.areaDesc: Curry County Coast; South Central Oregon Coast
